name: AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models
description: Collection of 7,302 strain-resolved genome-scale metabolic reconstructions of human gut microorganisms. Enables modeling of dysbiosis-associated metabolic shifts in CD, including depletion of butyrate-producing Firmicutes (F. prausnitzii, Roseburia) and expansion of Enterobacteriaceae. Supports integration with host intestinal epithelial cell models.
notes: Nature Biotechnology 2022 - includes strain-level resolution for studying CD-associated dysbiosis patterns
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Collection of 7,302 strain-resolved genome-scale metabolic reconstructions of human gut microorganisms. Enables modeling of dysbiosis-associated metabolic shifts in CD, including depletion of butyrate-producing Firmicutes (F. prausnitzii, Roseburia) and expansion of Enterobacteriaceae. Supports integration with host intestinal epithelial cell models.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models", "notes": "Nature Biotechnology 2022 - includes strain-level resolution for studying CD-associated dysbiosis patterns", "publication": "PMID:36543475", "repository_url": "https://www.vmh.life/"}

Enables modeling of dysbiosis-associated metabolic shifts in CD, including depletion of butyrate-producing Firmicutes (F. prausnitzii, Roseburia) and expansion of Enterobacteriaceae. Supports integration with host intestinal epithelial cell models.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models", "notes": "Nature Biotechnology 2022 - includes strain-level resolution for studying CD-associated dysbiosis patterns", "publication": "PMID:36543475", "repository_url": "https://www.vmh.life/"}

name: MICOM Community Metabolic Model
description: Metagenome-scale modeling framework for simulating metabolic interactions in the gut microbiota. Integrates dietary constraints and taxon abundances from metagenomic data to predict SCFA production deficits, cross-feeding network disruption, and pathobiont metabolic niches characteristic of CD dysbiosis.
notes: mSystems 2020 - enables personalized microbiome metabolic modeling; applied to IBD cohorts
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Metagenome-scale modeling framework for simulating metabolic interactions in the gut microbiota. Integrates dietary constraints and taxon abundances from metagenomic data to predict SCFA production deficits, cross-feeding network disruption, and pathobiont metabolic niches characteristic of CD dysbiosis.\n", "model_software": "COBRApy", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "MICOM Community Metabolic Model", "notes": "mSystems 2020 - enables personalized microbiome metabolic modeling; applied to IBD cohorts", "publication": "PMID:31964767"}
complex_fields_json: {"findings": [{"evidence": [{"explanation": "MICOM reveals personalized SCFA flux profiles relevant to understanding IBD heterogeneity.", "reference": "PMID:31964767", "snippet": "the community-level production of short-chain fatty acids (SCFAs) was heterogeneous and highly individual specific", "supports": "SUPPORT"}], "statement": "Community-level SCFA production is heterogeneous and highly individual-specific"}, {"evidence": [{"explanation": "Enables mechanistic understanding of metabolic networks disrupted in CD dysbiosis.", "reference": "PMID:31964767", "snippet": "Model output revealed complex cross-feeding interactions that would be difficult to measure in vivo", "supports": "SUPPORT"}], "statement": "Model output reveals complex cross-feeding interactions that would be difficult to measure in vivo"}]}

name: Host-Microbiome Multi-Objective Optimization Model
description: Integrated metabolic model combining human intestinal epithelial cell (IEC) metabolism with gut microbiome community models. Uses multi-objective optimization to predict competition, mutualism, and neutralism between host and microbial metabolism. Models SCFA exchange, amino acid cross-feeding, and metabolic interactions disrupted in CD.
notes: iScience 2024 - framework for quantifying host-microbiome metabolic crosstalk
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Integrated metabolic model combining human intestinal epithelial cell (IEC) metabolism with gut microbiome community models. Uses multi-objective optimization to predict competition, mutualism, and neutralism between host and microbial metabolism. Models SCFA exchange, amino acid cross-feeding, and metabolic interactions disrupted in CD.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "Host-Microbiome Multi-Objective Optimization Model", "notes": "iScience 2024 - framework for quantifying host-microbiome metabolic crosstalk", "publication": "PMID:38729159"}
raw_json: {"description": "Integrated metabolic model combining human intestinal epithelial cell (IEC) metabolism with gut microbiome community models. Uses multi-objective optimization to predict competition, mutualism, and neutralism between host and microbial metabolism. Models SCFA exchange, amino acid cross-feeding, and metabolic interactions disrupted in CD.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "Host-Microbiome Multi-Objective Optimization Model", "notes": "iScience 2024 - framework for quantifying host-microbiome metabolic crosstalk", "publication": "PMID:38729159"}

name: Alpha-Synuclein Aggregation BST Model
description: Biochemical Systems Theory (BST) model of alpha-synuclein aggregation kinetics in dopaminergic neurons. Integrates dopamine metabolism, ubiquitin-proteasome system, and lysosomal degradation pathways. Simulates effects of oxidative stress and proteasome inhibition on synuclein accumulation.
notes: First comprehensive kinetic model of PD-related protein aggregation
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Biochemical Systems Theory (BST) model of alpha-synuclein aggregation kinetics in dopaminergic neurons. Integrates dopamine metabolism, ubiquitin-proteasome system, and lysosomal degradation pathways. Simulates effects of oxidative stress and proteasome inhibition on synuclein accumulation.\n", "model_id": "BIOMD0000000575", "model_type": "KINETIC", "name": "Alpha-Synuclein Aggregation BST Model", "notes": "First comprehensive kinetic model of PD-related protein aggregation", "publication": "PMID:19136028", "repository_url": "https://www.ebi.ac.uk/biomodels/BIOMD0000000575"}

name: Whole Dopaminergic Neuron SBML Model
description: Large-scale Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) model of dopaminergic neuron containing 139 reactions and 111 metabolites. Captures dopamine synthesis, vesicular storage, release, reuptake, and degradation alongside mitochondrial function and oxidative stress.
notes: Enables simulation of drug effects on dopaminergic neurotransmission
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Large-scale Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) model of dopaminergic neuron containing 139 reactions and 111 metabolites. name: Basal Ganglia Spiking Neural Network
description: Computational model of the basal ganglia circuit capturing dopamine-modulated dynamics between striatum, globus pallidus, subthalamic nucleus, and substantia nigra. Simulates pathological beta-band oscillations and motor dysfunction in PD.
notes: Models circuit-level effects of dopamine depletion and DBS therapy
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Computational model of the basal ganglia circuit capturing dopamine-modulated dynamics between striatum, globus pallidus, subthalamic nucleus, and substantia nigra. Simulates pathological beta-band oscillations and motor dysfunction in PD.\n", "model_type": "PHYSIOLOGICAL", "name": "Basal Ganglia Spiking Neural Network", "notes": "Models circuit-level effects of dopamine depletion and DBS therapy", "publication": "PMID:29666208"}

Simulates pathological beta-band oscillations and motor dysfunction in PD.\n", "model_type": "PHYSIOLOGICAL", "name": "Basal Ganglia Spiking Neural Network", "notes": "Models circuit-level effects of dopamine depletion and DBS therapy", "publication": "PMID:29666208"}

name: Alpha-Synuclein Prion-like Spreading Model
description: Network diffusion model simulating prion-like propagation of misfolded alpha-synuclein through brain connectome. Uses graph-theoretical approach to predict spatial patterns of neurodegeneration from initial seeding sites.
notes: Predicts Braak staging patterns from connectivity-based spreading
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Network diffusion model simulating prion-like propagation of misfolded alpha-synuclein through brain connectome. Uses graph-theoretical approach to predict spatial patterns of neurodegeneration from initial seeding sites.\n", "model_type": "AGENT_BASED", "name": "Alpha-Synuclein Prion-like Spreading Model", "notes": "Predicts Braak staging patterns from connectivity-based spreading"}

Uses graph-theoretical approach to predict spatial patterns of neurodegeneration from initial seeding sites.\n", "model_type": "AGENT_BASED", "name": "Alpha-Synuclein Prion-like Spreading Model", "notes": "Predicts Braak staging patterns from connectivity-based spreading"}

name: Multi-compartment PKU FBA Model
description: Three-compartment FBA model with explicit blood-brain barrier transport for aromatic amino acids
notes: Explains brain-specific pathology and why Phe restriction outperforms Tyr supplementation

name: Harvey Whole-Body PKU Model
description: Sex-specific whole-body model (28 organs) for IEM biomarker prediction
notes: Predicts PKU biomarkers with ~85% accuracy across 57 IEMs

name: Pancreatic Beta Cell Genome-Scale Metabolic Model
description: First comprehensive genome-scale metabolic reconstruction of human pancreatic beta cells, integrating transcriptomic data from healthy and type 2 diabetic islets. The model captures beta cell-specific metabolic pathways and identifies metabolic alterations in T2D including impaired glucose-stimulated insulin secretion mechanisms.
notes: PLOS Computational Biology 2022 - context-specific reconstruction using RNA-seq from healthy and T2D beta cells
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "First comprehensive genome-scale metabolic reconstruction of human pancreatic beta cells, integrating transcriptomic data from healthy and type 2 diabetic islets. name: Whole-Body Human Metabolic Model for Diabetes
description: Multi-organ metabolic model (Harvey/Harvetta) capturing inter-organ metabolic fluxes in diabetes. Models liver, muscle, adipose, and pancreas metabolism with tissue-specific constraints derived from omics data.
notes: Predicts diabetes biomarkers and drug effects across multiple organs
scalar_fields_json: {"base_model": "Recon3D", "description": "Multi-organ metabolic model (Harvey/Harvetta) capturing inter-organ metabolic fluxes in diabetes. name: PBPK Model for GLP-1 Receptor Agonists
description: Physiologically-based pharmacokinetic model for GLP-1 receptor agonists (semaglutide, tirzepatide) in T2D patients. Incorporates drug absorption, distribution, and receptor binding kinetics to optimize dosing regimens.
notes: Used in clinical trial design and dose optimization for incretin-based therapies
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Physiologically-based pharmacokinetic model for GLP-1 receptor agonists (semaglutide, tirzepatide) in T2D patients. Incorporates drug absorption, distribution, and receptor binding kinetics to optimize dosing regimens.\n", "model_type": "PHYSIOLOGICAL", "name": "PBPK Model for GLP-1 Receptor Agonists", "notes": "Used in clinical trial design and dose optimization for incretin-based therapies"}

name: AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models
description: Collection of 7,302 strain-resolved genome-scale metabolic reconstructions of human gut microorganisms. Enables personalized microbiome-host metabolic modeling by integrating with human metabolic models (Recon3D). Captures strain-level variation in SCFA production, bile acid metabolism, and drug biotransformation relevant to T2D.
notes: Nature Biotechnology 2022 - includes drug metabolism capabilities for 98 drugs; enables community-level FBA with MICOM

name: MICOM Community Metabolic Model
description: Metagenome-scale modeling framework for simulating metabolic interactions in the gut microbiota. Integrates dietary constraints and taxon abundances from metagenomic data to predict personalized SCFA production, cross-feeding networks, and metabolic fluxes. Applied to T2D to study dysbiosis effects on butyrate production and glucose-insulin signaling.
notes: mSystems 2020 - enables personalized microbiome metabolic modeling from 16S/metagenomics data

name: AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models
description: Collection of 7,302 strain-resolved genome-scale metabolic reconstructions of human gut microorganisms. Enables modeling of UC-associated dysbiosis including loss of keystone SCFA producers (F. prausnitzii, Roseburia, Eubacterium rectale) and expansion of pathobionts (Fusobacterium, Enterobacteriaceae). Supports colonocyte energy metabolism modeling.
notes: Nature Biotechnology 2022 - strain-level resolution for butyrate producer depletion studies

Supports colonocyte energy metabolism modeling.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "AGORA2 Gut Microbiome Metabolic Models", "notes": "Nature Biotechnology 2022 - strain-level resolution for butyrate producer depletion studies", "publication": "PMID:36543475", "repository_url": "https://www.vmh.life/"}

name: MICOM Community Metabolic Model
description: Metagenome-scale modeling framework for simulating metabolic interactions in the gut microbiota. Models decreased butyrate production, impaired colonocyte energy metabolism, and Anna Karenina effect (increased community instability) observed in UC. Integrates with dietary intervention modeling.
notes: mSystems 2020 - enables personalized SCFA flux predictions from patient metagenomes

name: Host-Microbiome Multi-Objective Optimization Model
description: Integrated metabolic model combining human colonic epithelial cell metabolism with gut microbiome community models. Predicts metabolic crosstalk disruption in UC, including butyrate deprivation effects on colonocyte beta-oxidation and tight junction maintenance.
notes: iScience 2024 - models host-microbiome metabolic interactions at community scale
scalar_fields_json: {"description": "Integrated metabolic model combining human colonic epithelial cell metabolism with gut microbiome community models. Predicts metabolic crosstalk disruption in UC, including butyrate deprivation effects on colonocyte beta-oxidation and tight junction maintenance.\n", "model_type": "GENOME_SCALE_METABOLIC", "name": "Host-Microbiome Multi-Objective Optimization Model", "notes": "iScience 2024 - models host-microbiome metabolic interactions at community scale", "publication": "PMID:38729159"}
